speaker: Valoria, Bound
lines: You kneel and the city learns the wrong lesson.
Walls draw breath and hold it.
Banners bleach themselves to avoid being recognized when history looks back.
The fountain goes still enough to become a mirror no one likes.
Stalls stand at attention like soldiers who would rather be bread.
In the tower, the bell rings twice and forgets why.
A key grows out of your shadow and feels heavy without weight.
The Regent gifts you a token that opens doors you would be better for bypassing.
You do not throw it away.
